summary: This is an FBI daily briefing document from July 31, 2020, covering news across multiple categories including criminal investigations, counter-terrorism, counter-intelligence, and other FBI-related activities. It includes significant coverage of the Epstein case with newly unsealed deposition documents, as well as numerous other criminal cases, political developments, and national security issues.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier whose accuser alleged in newly unsealed deposition that Ghislaine Maxwell was his partner in abuse.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Epstein's former partner, accused of trafficking minors
persons.context: Arrested earlier in July 2020 and charged with trafficking minors; accused in unsealed deposition of being Epstein's partner in abuse.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Accused Epstein of years-long abuse beginning when she was a teenager; alleged in deposition that Maxwell recruited her and participated in abuse.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned multiple times in political context, including suggesting election delay, meeting with family of murdered soldier, and other presidential actions.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Mentioned in context of FBI review of surveillance applications and warnings about China election interference.

persons.name: Michael Flynn
persons.context: Case being reheard by full DC Appeals Court regarding DOJ's decision to drop case against him.

persons.name: Emmet Sullivan
persons.context: Judge in Michael Flynn case whose plan to examine DOJ's decision to drop case is being revisited by appeals court.

persons.name: Sidney Powell
persons.context: Represented Michael Flynn and commented on appeals court decision to rehear case.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Mentioned in context of Flynn case and Durham investigation.

persons.name: Chuck Grassley
persons.context: Pressed government agencies for documents related to Trump-Russia probe with Sen. Ron Johnson.

persons.name: Ron Johnson
persons.context: Pressed government agencies for documents related to Trump-Russia probe with Sen. Chuck Grassley.

persons.name: Igor Danchenko
persons.context: Identified as primary source for Steele dossier; senators seeking records of his correspondence.

persons.name: David Laufman
persons.context: Former chief of DOJ's counterintelligence section; senators seeking records of his correspondence with Igor Danchenko.

persons.name: John Durham
persons.context: Conducting criminal inquiry into Russia investigation; report anticipated.

persons.name: Dan Bongino
persons.context: Claimed Durham's report will be "horrifying for the Democrats."

persons.name: Mike Pompeo
persons.context: Testified before Senate committees, discussed China threats and Afghanistan.

persons.name: Li Chen
persons.role: Researcher accused of stealing trade secrets
persons.context: Pleaded guilty to conspiring to steal trade secrets from Nationwide Children's Hospital and transfer to China.

persons.name: Yu Zhou
persons.context: Charged with Li Chen for stealing trade secrets; case still pending.

persons.name: Devin Nunes
persons.context: Pressed by Democrats about receiving anti-Biden information from Ukrainian official Andrii Derkach.

persons.name: Andrii Derkach
persons.context: Kremlin-linked Ukrainian who sent anti-Biden information packets to Republican lawmakers.

persons.name: Vanessa Guillen
persons.context: Family met with President Trump who pledged rigorous investigation into her death.

persons.name: Chris Swecker
persons.context: Leading independent review into Vanessa Guillen's death at Fort Hood.

persons.name: Enrique Roman-Martinez
persons.context: FBI joining Army investigation into his killing.

persons.name: Larry Householder
persons.context: Removed as Ohio House speaker after arrest on federal corruption allegations in $60 million bribery scheme.

persons.name: Matt Borges
persons.context: Arrested with Householder in alleged bribery scheme.

persons.name: Jeffrey Longstreth
persons.context: Arrested with Householder in alleged bribery scheme.

persons.name: Neil Clark
persons.context: Arrested with Householder in alleged bribery scheme.

persons.name: Juan Cespedes
persons.context: Arrested with Householder in alleged bribery scheme.

persons.name: Jose Huizar
persons.context: Indicted on 34 counts in corruption probe involving alleged bribery from Chinese developer.

persons.name: Michael Cohen
persons.context: Free to publish anti-Trump book while serving sentence at home after government dropped media ban.

persons.name: Barack Obama
persons.context: Delivered eulogy for John Lewis, criticized Trump administration policies.

persons.name: John Lewis
persons.context: Funeral held with three former presidents in attendance; Obama delivered eulogy.

persons.name: George Bush
persons.context: Attended John Lewis funeral and delivered remarks.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Attended John Lewis funeral and delivered remarks.

persons.name: Ruth Bader Ginsburg
persons.context: Resting in hospital following minimally invasive surgery on bile duct stent.

persons.name: James Bridenstine
persons.context: Commented on Perseverance rover launch to Mars.

connections.description: Epstein accuser alleged in unsealed deposition that Maxwell was his partner in abuse and chief accomplice.
Giuffre alleged Maxwell recruited her as a teenager to serve as Epstein's traveling masseuse and participated in abuse.
Powell is Flynn's attorney representing him in legal case regarding dropped charges.
Senators jointly pressing government agencies for documents related to Trump-Russia probe.
Senators seeking records of correspondence between Danchenko (Steele dossier source) and Laufman (former DOJ official).
Married couple accused of conspiring to steal trade secrets from Nationwide Children's Hospital for China.
Both arrested in alleged $60 million bribery scheme related to Ohio nuclear bailout legislation.
Cohen was Trump's personal lawyer who is now publishing anti-Trump book while serving sentence.

events.title: Epstein accuser deposition unsealed
events.description: Virginia Giuffre's deposition unsealed alleging Ghislaine Maxwell was Jeffrey Epstein's partner in abuse and participated in sexual abuse.

events.title: Full DC Appeals Court to rehear Flynn case
events.description: Full US Court of Appeals for DC Circuit agreed to revisit Judge Emmet Sullivan's plan to examine DOJ's decision to drop case against Michael Flynn.

events.title: Trump suggests delaying November election
events.description: President Trump tweeted suggesting delay of November election due to concerns about mail-in voting fraud, immediately rejected by Republicans and Democrats.

events.title: John Lewis funeral
events.description: Funeral for Rep. John Lewis held in Atlanta with three former presidents in attendance; Obama delivered eulogy criticizing Trump administration.

events.title: US GDP reports record contraction
events.description: US economy shrank at annual rate of 32.9% in second quarter, worst contraction on record due to coronavirus pandemic.

events.title: Trump meets with Vanessa Guillen's family
events.description: President Trump met with family of murdered Fort Hood soldier Vanessa Guillen, pledged rigorous investigation.

events.title: Ohio House removes Speaker Householder
events.description: Ohio House voted unanimously to remove Larry Householder as speaker after his arrest on federal corruption charges in $60 million bribery scheme.

events.title: NASA Perseverance rover launches to Mars
events.description: NASA's Perseverance rover launched on mission to Mars to search for signs of ancient life.

locations: Cape Lookout National Seashore, North Carolina
keyFacts: Virginia Giuffre alleged in newly unsealed deposition that Ghislaine Maxwell was Jeffrey Epstein's partner in abuse and participated in sexual abuse.
Full DC Appeals Court agreed to rehear Michael Flynn case, revisiting Judge Emmet Sullivan's examination of DOJ's decision to drop charges.
President Trump suggested delaying November election over mail-in voting concerns, but was immediately rejected by Republican and Democratic leaders.
FBI review found only minor errors in surveillance applications, contradicting Justice Department inspector general's findings of significant problems.
US economy contracted at record 32.9% annual rate in second quarter due to coronavirus pandemic impacts.
